body_content.explanation: letters, etc. that are delivered to homes or places of work:
examples: I'd been away for a few days so I had a lot of post waiting for me.
My secretary usually opens my post, unless it's marked "private".
Has the post come/arrived yet?

body_content.explanation: the public system that exists for the collecting and delivering of letters:
examples: My letter must have got lost in the post.
If you don't want to take it there, you can just send it by post.

body_content.explanation: the time during the day when letters, etc. are collected or delivered:
examples: I missed the post this morning.
Did you manage to catch the post?

body_content.explanation: a job in a company or organization:
examples: Teaching posts are advertised in Tuesday's edition of the paper.
She's held the post for 13 years.
They have several vacant posts.

body_content.explanation: doing a particular job in a company or organization:
examples: He has been in post since February 2015.

body_content.explanation: a vertical stick or pole stuck into the ground, usually to support something or show a position
used as a combining form:
examples: a lamppost
a signpost

body_content.explanation: in the sport of horse racing, the place where the race finishes or, less often, the place from which the race starts:
examples: It was a photo finish at the post.
Bloomer's Pride pulled ahead right before the post.

body_content.explanation: in sports such as football, a goalpost (= either of two vertical posts showing the area in which the ball is kicked to score points):
examples: The shot hit the post and bounced out of bounds.

body_content.explanation: a rectangular area marked on a basketball court (= playing area) in front of the basket :
examples: He set up in the post and brought down a rebound.
The post is often painted a different colour from the rest of the court.

body_content.explanation: the particular place where someone works, especially where a soldier is told to be for military duty, usually as a guard:
examples: The soldier was disciplined for deserting his post.
I was ordered to remain at my post until the last customer had left.

body_content.explanation: something such as a message or picture that you publish on a website or using social media:
examples: Lots of people have commented on my post.
You can change your privacy settings so that only certain people can see your posts.

body_content.explanation: to send a letter or parcel by post:
examples: Did you remember to post my letter?
I must post that parcel (off) or she won't get it in time for her birthday.
Could you post me the details/post the details to me?

body_content.explanation: to put an object through a letterbox (= special opening in a door):
examples: Just post the key through the door after you've locked it.

body_content.explanation: to send someone to a particular place to work:
examples: He's been posted to Pakistan for six months.
Guards were posted at all the doors.

body_content.explanation: to stick or pin a notice on a wall in order to make it publicly known:
examples: Company announcements are usually posted (up) on the noticeboard.

body_content.explanation: to publish something such as a message or picture on a website or using social media:
examples: I never post anything on the Internet that I wouldn't want my boss to see.
She hardly ever posts on Facebook.
Somebody's been posting obscene messages in this chat room.

body_content.explanation: to pay money, especially so that a person who has been accused of committing a crime can be free until their trial:
examples: She has agreed to post bail for her brother.

body_content.explanation: to announce a company's financial results:
examples: The oil company posted profits of $25.1 billion.

body_content.explanation: after or later than:
examples: postgraduate
postoperative
He took a post-lunch nap.
